---
title: "Data Sources"
output: html_document
---

National annual average of 15,000 miles for drivers sourced from the [Federal Highway Administration](https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/ohim/onh00/bar8.htm)
 
Data on the average fuel economy sourced from the [Corporate Average Fuel Economy Public Information Center Fleet Performance Report](https://explore.dot.gov/t/NHTSA-CAFE/views/CAFEPICReport-FleetPerformance/FleetPerformanceReportDashboard )

Monthly regular maintenance costs sourced from the AAA article, ["What Does It Cost to Own and Operate a Car"](https://www.aaa.com/autorepair/articles/What-Does-It-Cost-To-Own-And-Operate-A-Car)

Regional food price data scraped from [Target.com](https://www.target.com)

Rent prices for each city scraped from [Apartments.com](https://www.apartments.com)

Population numbers sourced from the [2020 United States Decennial Census](https://api.census.gov/data/2020/dec/pl?get=P1_001N,NAME&for=place:*)

Undergraduate enrollment sourced from the Department of Education's [College Scorecard](https://collegescorecard.ed.gov/data/)

University type (Flagship, Land Grant, Regional, Mixed, or Black) sourced from a [2009 report on College Towns from the University of New Hampshire](https://web.archive.org/web/20120217011024/http://pubpages.unh.edu/~gumprech/Collegetowns.pdf)
